Subject: Using Matlab SetEnergy function for isothermal kinetics
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=217501675
X-Yahoo-Profile: tighe_chris
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 11 Mar 2005 15:06:32 -0000



I thought this might be useful to some of you!

I've had a small (but easy to fix) problem defining a reactor as
isothermal using the SetEnergy function. I'm using Matlab 7.0 although
I think this applies to all versions.

For isothermal kinetics insert the following line in your Matlab code:

SetEnergy(<reactor name>, 'off');

And change the SetEnergy.m function in the
cantera/matlab/toolbox/cantera/@reactor folder to:

-------------

function setEnergy(f, flag)
% SETENERGY - 
%

check = strcmp(flag, 'on');

if check == 1;
  iflag = 1;
else
  iflag = 0;
end
reactormethods(9, f.index, iflag);

-------------

Cheers,
Chris.
